definition: to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate

sentences.chinese: 考慮把你的訪客進行細分。

sentences.english: Mr Feng was crouching in a dark corner, indifferent to the visitors.
sentences.chinese: 馮先生在一個黑暗的角落裏彎着腰，對訪客很冷淡。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, in the butterfly hall, visitors marvel at the beautiful insects.
sentences.chinese: 同時在蝴蝶廳裏，訪客爲這美麗的昆蟲所驚豔。

sentences.english: The visitor understood well the sadness and helplessness of the family.
sentences.chinese: 而訪客也頗能深切地感受到，病家憂慮無助的心情。

sentences.english: Afternoon - Barack and Michelle Obama go for private audience with the Queen
sentences.chinese: 下午，奧巴馬伕婦作爲私人訪客拜見女王？。

sentences.english: The goal is to get a good cross-section of visitors testing the new design options.
sentences.chinese: 目標是在新設計測試中獲得良好的交叉訪客。

sentences.english: Mandarin inscriptions fill the museum’s guest books.
sentences.chinese: 訪客留名簿上寫滿了漢字題字。

sentences.english: Visitors, although, would be able to use an in-built search function.
sentences.chinese: 訪客，雖然，將能夠使用內置的搜索功能。

sentences.english: There's a Chinese saying that goes "a woman in confinement should not be visited".
sentences.chinese: 中國有這樣一個說法，女人坐月子時是不能有訪客的。

sentences.english: Wang actively discourages visitors from commenting on his blog.
sentences.chinese: 王主動地阻止訪客在他的博客上做評論。

sentences.english: Remember that you are a visitor to their home.
sentences.chinese: 記得，你只是在它們家園裏的訪客。

sentences.english: Visitors, if allowed by the health care facility should be kept to a minimum.
sentences.chinese: 若衛生機關允許訪客，仍應將數量減到最低。

sentences.english: 6 - Track your visitors and site stats .
sentences.chinese: 追蹤你的訪客和訪問統計。

sentences.english: There, the visitors found a second city of cardboard condos.
sentences.chinese: 訪客在此可看到一個紙板公寓的城中城。

sentences.english: These type of sales let your visitors and customers know your no scrooge.
sentences.chinese: 這類銷售讓你不知道你的訪客和顧客守財奴。

sentences.english: But we have no evidence of such alien visitations.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們還沒有外星訪客的證據。

definition: to pass through/to penetrate/by means of/via
to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
employee/person employed in a trade or profession
to enter the venue for a meeting/to enter into an examination/to enter a stadium, arena etc
